name: Arugula and Romaine Salad with Red Grapes
author: Iker Aceves
summary: I looked into my refrigerator to see what I had...and the ingredients jumped to my imagination. I thought: I think this has to taste good and go well with my baked grouper dinner...and it was not only good but great! The mild bitterness of the arugula and the sweetness of grapes and pickled veggies is a perfect combination. A cool crisp pinot bianco is the perfect match.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
½ cup red seedless grapes, halved
directions: Whisk water, white vinegar, and sugar together in a bowl until sugar has dissolved
Stir cucumber and onion into the vinegar mixture; cover and refrigerate for 3 hours
Toss romaine lettuce and arugula with olive oil and balsamic vinegar in a large bowl
Season with salt and black pepper
Divide salad on 2 plates and scatter cucumber mixture and grapes on top to serve
